name: Hotel Margherita

reviews.title: Very nice!!
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Margherita, largely on the basis of reviews found here. With one exception, the hotel lived up to expectations, and is, I think, an outstanding place to stay.

reviews.title: Lovely Service and Spacious Room
reviews.text: The hotel is located on the main street in the old part of town, which means that it is on the other side of the pedestrian tunnel from the train station. While not far, there is no escalator at the train station, and it is a bit uphill from the station. If you are not travelling light, it can be a bit of a slog. There are cabs available, but are easier to get for the return trip.

reviews.title: Great Stay at the Hotel Margherita
reviews.text: The hotel, as many have said, has recently been renovated, and is in beautiful condition. From the rich colors on the outside, to the modern furnishings, the excellent A/C to the outstanding breakfasts, to modern bathrooms, there is nothing that is not top-notch. Breakfasts, in particular, where outstanding - the best we experienced in our trip.

reviews.title: A Great Choice
reviews.text: Making reservations was very easy, I used their website, and it was straightforward, and clear, and there were no problems with check-in. The hotel supplies you with nice beach towels for people who spend time at the beach.

reviews.title: Just ok
reviews.text: The one area that we were disappointed, and perhaps its just of function of expectations, was in the level of service. We found the staff to be somewhat stand-offish , particularly Renato, who was not friendly, and not very helpful. Other hotels we have stayed at had owners who made it a point to anticipate travelers needs, for example having directions prepared for frequently asked destinations. We purchased some postcards, and asked whether we could purchase stamps for them. Not an uncommon request, but we were basically just pointed in the direction of the local post office. This may seem like nit-picking, and actually did not detract, for us, from the other very positive qualities of the hotel, but given some of the raves that staff have recieved, we expected more.

reviews.title: Nice place to stay!
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Switzerland and Italy for our honeymoon. We stayed two nights at Hotel Margherita. The rooms were VERY clean and had new modern-style furniture, a nice staff and good a breakfast. The hotel was in a nice location near the beach, restaurants and shops. I am very picky about where to stay when going abroad; Hotel Margherita was good bet. I would very much recommend this hotel!

reviews.title: Home away from home
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Cinque Terre and to say Hotel Margherita was superb would be an understatement! We have traveled extensively and found Renato the owner of the hotel to be a gracious host; placing customer satisfaction at a premium. The hotel had it all: centrally located; easy access to ferry, town; gelato and all restaurants. From the moment we walked into the newly renovated and spacious lobby, it felt like home. We were greated in English and Italian and thank goodness, because we didn't speak a word of Italian. We were then shown up to our HUGE and beautifully decorated room, with a terrace and beautiful and spacious bathroom. Even though there were only two of us, the junior suite was roomy enough to sleep 4 people comfortably. The price included a breakfast buffet which more than satisfied any tastes with its array of options. In the evening, it was nice to enjoy a glass of wine on the conveniently located patio. A word of advice; if you take the train to Monterroso, pay the 7 euros to take a taxi-we overpacked like typical Americans, so it was well worth it! The dress is very casual-i.e. shorts, capris, and jeans are welcomed. When we return to Cinque Terre, we will DEFINITELY visit Hotel Margherita!!! Five Stars.

reviews.title: Fab Hotel!
reviews.text: p.s. We left an item in our room and Renato, the owner, mailed it to us in Colorado with pleasure. What an experience!!!!!

reviews.title: Classy joint in the heart of town.
reviews.text: I travelled with my Mum to the Cinque Terre area for a relaxing holiday to finish of a month work trip, we decided to stay at Monterosso ( def the best area to stay out of the 5) and Hotel Margherita from reading the trip adviser reviews..Im so glad we did this!!

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: We had THE best time.

reviews.title: Perfect Match
reviews.text: The choice of Monterosso and The Margherita were the perfect match. The hotel is modern, clean and quiet. The staff were friendly and the breakfast is very good. It is far enough, but not too far, from the beach front to avoid any noise from visiting groups nor can you hear the trains. We felt Monterosso was the best choice of town too.

reviews.title: Terrific hotel
reviews.text: We only stayed one night but can't say enough nice things about the property and staff (save one grumpy male employee that you just had to sweet talk!). Our room was lovely and although the bath room was smaller than most we had been in, the shower was powerful. Unfortunately we were in a room (#201) that was at the top of the staircase so we heard anyone and everyone that was coming up the stairs (unfortunately it was mostly obnoxious, loud Americans). The breakfast room was delightfully bright and I thought that the items served were totally adequate --- much better in fact than the prior 3 hotels in Italy that we had been to. I would definitely stay here again. Yes the price is higher than most and yes the signage is difficult and yes there is not beach view, but who is in their room long enough to enjoy a view anyway?

reviews.title: A Treasure in the Cinque Terre Area
reviews.text: My husband and I are over 60, and are relatively high maintenance travelers. We discovered this hotel while visiting our son and daughter-in-law, who were staying there. We immediately changed our existing reservations in La Spezia and moved into the Hotel Margherita for five nights. We couldn't have been happier that we did.

reviews.title: GREAT PLACE - would stay there again!
reviews.text: The hotel offers modern ammenities, like an elevator, but most importantly, if offers clean and comfortable rooms, (ours had a balcony overlooking the street), a very good breakfast, and the most helpful staff you can imagine. The owners, Renato Frezza and Serena Arpe, went above and beyond to help us ship some packages home. The location on the main street of Monterosso is convenient and colorful.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: It's an easy walk from the train station, but the local bus works well, too. We are already planning our return to the area and to the hotel next year. It was molto bene!

reviews.title: Very friendly italian owner
reviews.text: The hotel and town was perfect. We stayed two nights from the 30th to the 2nd of july. Very friendly staff. Large rooms and bathrooms, balcony and eveything. We were welcomed by the owner himself later in the afternoon and a taste of his personal "champagne like" white wine. The staff gave us very good advice to select the best typical restaurants each night in or out of town. Nothing bad to say, we would go there again anytime, ... and we will very soon !

reviews.title: Perfect....Just what we needed. - Family from Boston
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor. Although I've been to Italy several times it was my first time in Cinque Terre. Travelling with 7 - my wife, two kids, 79 yr. old father, sister-in-law, and nephew, it was the perfect respite from the heat and humidity in Rome. We arrived by train and took a taxi to Hotel Margherita - we'll worth the money if you have a lot of luggage. Renato checked us in and made us feel like we were family right away. My father speaks Italian so it made it a little easier. The breakfast lady (forget her name) is from Guayaquil Ecuador, so my Spanish came in handy too. Renato gave us each a complimentary beer upon check in (the kids cokes), and he sat and chatted with us. He broke out a jar of green tomatoes and olives that his mother canned for him, some bread, and we had a feast! The hotel was clean and modern and the rooms were spacious by Italian standards (was a little disappointed when we booked the junior suite with a balcony and ended up with a 1st floor (albeit large) handicapped room - not a problem but the kids got shower water all over the place as there was no tub at the bottom of the shower -- Room 1 if anyone is interested). Renato recommended (and made reservations) at two great restaurants for us. One a short walk from the hotel, the other on top of the mountain overlooking Monterosso (the restaurant has a shuttle van that brings you up and back). The beach is only a couple blocks away - the wife and the kids went to the beach while my father and I visited the other 4 villages. Totally comfortable environment to let the teenage kids wander around. The boys actually got involved in a basketball game with some locals at the little soccer/basketball court right in front of the beach. One night when we got back to the hotel, Renato broke out his special grappa for us to enjoy....he told us he had two bottles...one he sold to clients, the other he kept for himself...he shared his personal bottle with us....again making us feel at home....Lots of fun....I'd definitely go back and absolutely would stay at Hotel Margherita again.

reviews.title: excellent stay in monterosso
reviews.text: hotel margherita is new, modern, clean and located in the heart of the old town. always quiet. strong water pressure with instant hot water. my single room was the size of most doubles. owner renato is on site 18 hours a day and sets the high standards for his cheerful, friendly & helpful staff of serena, francesca, & carmen. they were always a great help with restaurant recommendations, directions, boat schedules, etc.

reviews.title: Disappointed. Sparse rooms, unfriendly staff
reviews.text: very nice breakfast. but be sure to have a glass of wine in the evening on the relaxing patio. a very generous pour of vino served with complimentary pecorino cheese and the best pepperoncini you will find anywhere. va bene! perfetto!

description: Hotel Margherita is at your disposal to make your stay pleasant and relaxing, in a tasteful and comfortable environment. Located in the center of the historic town of Monterosso, we are just a few steps from the beaches, touristic port, trails, local shops and many restaurants to choose from. Our courteous Reception and Management staff, are always at your disposal to provide you with all the information needed for the famous hiking trails, tours by boat and train transportation within the park of the Cinque Terre. After the mudslide that hit Monterosso in October 2011, the hotel has been completely renovated. The hotel has a common living area with free Wi-Fi, satellite tv, bar and private patio that looks out onto the old fascinating town of Monterosso. In the morning you can enjoy a delicious breakfast in our inviting breakfast room, where you can find a wide variety of choices from our breakfast buffet.All of our rooms are equipped with air-conditioning, satellite tv, telephone, Wi-Fi access, mini fridge and safe. All rooms have private bathrooms with a shower and hair dryer.
